awd_titl_txt: High-Resolution NMR Spectroscopy of Geologically Important  Crystals and Glasses
awd_abstract_narration: This project represents a continuation of research previously                   supported by NSF Grant EAR84-08421, involving detailed structural               studies of geological materials using nuclear magnetic resonance                (NMR) spectrometry.  Specific objectives of the project include:                (1) continued studies of structurally complex crystalline phases                such as feldspars (particularly e-plagioclase and alkali feld-                  spars) and mixed-layer clays; (2) studies of structures and phase               transitions in silicate minerals at elevated temperatures (up to                700C); and (3) studies of structural states of aluminosilicate                 glasses quenched from high pressures.  The results of these                     studies will enhance our understanding of the fundamental                       properties and behavior of geological materials.
